exploration.paretoExploration.gridexploration

Class GridBasedExploration

  • java.lang.Object
    • exploration.Explorer
      • exploration.paretoExploration.gridexploration.GridBasedExploration

  • public class GridBasedExploration
extends Explorer
    Grid-based Design Space Exploration of multi-dimensional design space. In this algorithm, we specify the design space to be explored, the upper and lower bounds. The algorithm then divides this design space using grid and then queries all the points on the grid, only if they don't fall in the known area (forward cone of SAT point or backward cone of UNSAT point).
    Author:
    Pranav Tendulkar

    • Field Detail

      • epsilon

        private double epsilon
        Current epsilon value of the grid. Initially this value is 0.5, and we divide it by 2 to make grid finer at every iteration.

      • satPointsList

        private java.util.List<Point> satPointsList
        List of all the SAT points explored.

      • paretoPoints

        private java.util.List<Point> paretoPoints
        List of Pareto Points from the exploration.

      • satPointsModelList

        private java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> satPointsModelList
        Model for every SAT point discovered in the exploration.

      • paretoModelList

        private java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> paretoModelList
        Model for every Pareto point from the exploration.

      • algoSatPointsList

        private java.util.List<Point> algoSatPointsList
        SAT points in the exploration. In this list we do not save any dominated SAT points.

      • algoUnsatPointsList

        private java.util.List<Point> algoUnsatPointsList
        UNSAT points in the exploration. In this list we do not save any dominated UNSAT points.

      • lowerBounds

        private int[] lowerBounds
        Lower bounds for the exploration.

      • upperBounds

        private int[] upperBounds
        Upper bounds for the exploration.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GridBasedExploration

        public GridBasedExploration(java.lang.String opDir,
                    int perQueryTimeOutSeconds,
                    int totalTimeOutInSeconds,
                    ExplorationParameters explParams)
        Initialize the grid-based explorer.
        Parameters:
        opDir - output directory to write all the log files
        perQueryTimeOutSeconds - time out per query in seconds
        totalTimeOutInSeconds - global time out in seconds for all the exploration
        explParams - Exploration parameters

    • Method Detail

      • addUnsatToList

        private void addUnsatToList(Point point)
        Add UNSAT point to the list. We remove the dominated points so that we have size of the list as minimum as possible.
        Parameters:
        point - new point to be added

      • addSatToList

        private void addSatToList(Point point)
        Add SAT point to the list. We remove the dominated points so that we have size of the list as minimum as possible.
        Parameters:
        point - new point to be added

      • readModelFile

        private void readModelFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                 java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> satPointsModelList)
        Convert the string in the model file to List of model maps.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the model file
        satPointsModelList - list where SAT models will be stored.

      • readFileToArray

        private void readFileToArray(java.lang.String fileName,
                   java.lang.String[] paramStrings,
                   java.util.List<Point> listToAdd)
        Read a log file of exploration to read SAT / UNSAT / TIMED OUT points.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the file to be read
        paramStrings - String in the file between the information field
        listToAdd - list where all the read points will be stored

      • readExploredPoints

        public void readExploredPoints(java.lang.String resultsDirectory)
        If we want to continue a previous exploration, we could just read the log file and continue from the point where the exploration stopped. If we stopped in middle of a SMT query, of course that query is lost.
        Parameters:
        resultsDirectory - the directory where all the log files are stored.

      • getSatPoints

        public java.util.List<Point> getSatPoints()
        Get list of all the SAT points found during the exploration.
        Returns:
        List of SAT points

      • getParetoPoints

        public java.util.List<Point> getParetoPoints()
        Get all the Pareto points found from this exploration.
        Returns:
        list of Parete points

      • getParetoModels

        public java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getParetoModels()
        Get list of model for each Pareto point found in exploration.
        Returns:
        list of model for every Pareto point

      • calcParetoPoints

        private void calcParetoPoints()
        Calculate Pareto points from the list of SAT and UNSAT points

      • checkIfExplorationGranularityReached

        private boolean checkIfExplorationGranularityReached()
        Check if the granularity of the exploration has reached for each dimension.
        Returns:
        true if exploration granularity has reached, else false

      • performQuery

        private Z3Solver.SatResult performQuery(Point queryPoint)
        Perform a SMT query.
        Parameters:
        queryPoint - The point where the query should be asked.
        Returns:
        SAT / UNSAT / TIMED OUT depending on the result from the SMT solver.

      • pointToValue

        private double pointToValue(int dimension,
                  double epsilon,
                  int point)
        Calculate where the point would reside in the design space. Imagine the grid has 5 steps in horizontal and vertical dimension in 2D exploration. So there will be total 25 intersections. If we number these points, we want to know the co-ordinates in the design space to perform a query.
        Parameters:
        dimension - dimension where the value is to be obtained
        epsilon - current epsilon value
        point - the number of point
        Returns:
        value corresponding to the design space.

      • binarySearch

        private boolean binarySearch(int dimension,
                   double lowerBound,
                   double upperBound,
                   Point queryPoint,
                   double higherDimEpsilon)
        Perform a binary search on a given dimension.
        Parameters:
        dimension - dimension to be explored
        lowerBound - lower bound to be explored
        upperBound - upper bound to be explored
        queryPoint - current Point which is being queried
        higherDimEpsilon - epsilon to be used for the higher dimension
        Returns:
        true if global timeout, false otherwise

      • getTrueBounds

        private double[] getTrueBounds(Point queryPoint)
        Get bounds according to the unknown area where we should perform the binary search exploration.
        Parameters:
        queryPoint - Current query point under consideration
        Returns:
        Returns array containing lower and upper bound for the last dimension

      • containsLowestPoint

        private boolean containsLowestPoint()
        If the exploration happens such that the point (0,0) returns a SAT value, then there is no need in exploring other points, because it will anyways dominate all the other points. TODO : Perhaps this was old method, I must check if this should be still used or not.
        Returns:
        true if sat point list contains the lowest dominating point.

      • printLimitInfo

        private void printLimitInfo()
        Prints the upper, lower bounds and exploration granularity.

      • explore

        public void explore()
        Perform grid-based exploration

      • checkIfSatOrUnsat

        private Z3Solver.SatResult checkIfSatOrUnsat(Point point)
        Check if the point falls in SAT or UNSAT known area. Known area is forward cone of SAT point and backward cone of UNSAT point.
        Parameters:
        point - point to be checked if it falls in unknown area
        Returns:
        SAT if falls in sat area, UNSAT if in unsat area, or UNKNOWN if in unknown area
